content: 'The Exodus': Latinos Leaving NC In Droves As Incomes Drop, More Latinos Head Home WINSTON-SALEM -- Adios North Carolina. It's what local Latinos are calling "The Exodus," as the housing crisis is forcing thousands to return to their homes south of the border. Fourteen buses each week bound for Mexico City leave from the Winston-Salem bus depot, but for many of the passengers on board, the ticket is one way only. Full article at > >http://www.wxii12.com/money/19067810/detail.html The recession seems to have a few up sides.

content: Some much for the arguement on how the illegals contribute to our economy quote: "They come and talk to me and say we go to back to Mexico," Quadra said. "When you do not have any more opportunities for you for improving your life, for sending money back to Mexico, you begin to wonder." Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
